citations.narrative:
A primary enclosure failed to protect a bird from a predation event.
On 2/4/2025, the facility reported to the USDA via email that they had lost their one-eyed red-shouldered hawk due to a
predation event on 12/20/2024. At the time of the inspection, the facility representative explained that this conclusion was
made about a predation event due to the condition of the various body parts in and around the enclosure, tufts of feathers
between enclosure wiring, and feathers trailing 15 feet into the woods outside of the enclosure. This specific bird had a
significant disability and the enclosure was not designed to protect this animal from predation. Birds that are not protected
from hazards or predation may suffer from stress, injury, or death. Correct by ensuring that bird enclosures are
maintained in good repair, protect the birds from injury, contain the birds, and restrict other animals from entering who
may negatively affect the welfare of the birds within. Corrected before the time of inspection on 2/25/2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.150(a)  Critical
   
Facilities, general. 
A primary enclosure failed to protect a bird from a predation event. 
On 2/4/2025, the facility reported to the USDA via email that they had lost their one-eyed red-shouldered hawk due to a 
predation event on 12/20/2024. At the time of the inspection, the facility representative explained that this conclusion was 
made about a predation event due to the condition of the various body parts in and around the enclosure, tufts of feathers 
between enclosure wiring, and feathers trailing 15 feet into the woods outside of the enclosure. This specific bird had a 
significant disability and the enclosure was not designed to protect this animal from predation. Birds that are not protected 
from hazards or predation may suffer from stress, injury, or death. Correct by ensuring that bird enclosures are 
maintained in good repair, protect the birds from injury, contain the birds, and restrict other animals from entering who 
may negatively affect the welfare of the birds within. Corrected before the time of inspection on 2/25/2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n
